methods: New allocation rule based on Shapley value, considering first-order combination of hyperedges
results: Properties of Shapley and Myerson values hold for the new allocation rule
Relationship with Forman curvature in discrete geometry
title: New allocation rule of directed hypergraphs
abstract: The Shapley value, one of the well-known allocation rules in game theory, does not take into account information about the structure of the graph, so by using the Shapley value for each hyperedge, we introduce a new allocation rule by considering their first-order combination. We proved that some of the properties that hold for Shapley and Myerson values also hold for our allocation rule. In addition, we found the relationship between our allocation rule and the Forman curvature, which plays an important role in discrete geometry.
